ThingDef.label: badger
ThingDef.description: A small, extremely hardy animal that ranges wide across forests and shrubland. It's not afraid of much and can be quite aggressive.

ThingDef.label: brown donkey
ThingDef.description: A common donkey. Makes a good companion for crossing large swaths of harsh terrain. Can survive off sparse amounts of food.

ThingDef.label: black donkey
ThingDef.description: A strong, fast donkey. Makes a formidable foe in combat and an excellent companion on the range.

ThingDef.label: grey donkey
ThingDef.description: The fastest donkey in the rim. Valued for its quick nature and its beautiful looks. Also quite gluttunous.

ThingDef.label: gila monster
ThingDef.description: These medium-sized lizards feed on smaller animals. \n\nDon't let Gila Monsters fool you; their sluggish nature hides quite a dangerous bite.

ThingDef.label: moose
ThingDef.description: A very large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates. Domesticated moose can be milked, but refuse to carry packs.

ThingDef.label: bison
ThingDef.description: A large-sized herding herbivore. Generally peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: coyote
ThingDef.description: Small wolf-like creatures that hunt in packs. If disturbed in the wild, they are very likely to attack.

ThingDef.label: rattlesnake
ThingDef.description: A large predatory snake. Rattlesnakes can be highly aggressive if provoked, and their bite injects toxic venom into the victim.

ThingDef.label: wapiti
ThingDef.description: A large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates. Domesticated wapiti can be milked, but refuse to carry packs.
